pullRequest.title: CATROID-506 create new "Store csv.." brick
pullRequest.bodyText:
added new layout
added new brick to data category
enabled different seperators
added catrobatTests: EmptyLists, Multiplications, String concatenation, different Seperators
on fail: return empty list
Please enter a short description of your pull request and add a reference to the Jira ticket.
Your checklist for this pull request
Please review the contributing guidelines and wiki pages of this repository.

 Include the name of the Jira ticket in the PR’s title
 Include a summary of the changes plus the relevant context
 Choose the proper base branch (develop)
 Confirm that the changes follow the project’s coding guidelines
 Verify that the changes generate no compiler or linter warnings
 Perform a self-review of the changes
 Verify to commit no other files than the intentionally changed ones
 Include reasonable and readable tests verifying the added or changed behavior
 Confirm that new and existing unit tests pass locally
 Check that the commits’ message style matches the project’s guideline
 Stick to the project’s gitflow workflow
 Verify that your changes do not have any conflicts with the base branch
 After the PR, verify that all CI checks have passed
 Post a message in the catroid-stage or catroid-ide Slack channel and ask for a code reviewer

beforeCommit.message:
CATROID-506 create new "Store csv.." brick

added new layout
added new brick to data category
enabled different seperators
added catrobatTests: EmptyLists, Multiplications, String concatenation, different Seperators

on fail: return empty list

nodes.bodyText: pls do it one try catch block and not 3 seperate ones (IF it is possible ). Additionally check if the overrided method has exception handling itself.
why is here a reference to the webrequestbrick?

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_data">CSV data</string>
          
          
            
                <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_data">cat,cute
          
          
            
            puppy,naughty
          
          
            
            octopus,intelligent</string>
          
      
    
    
  

Please change it as suggested so that it is a more suggestive and understandable example for our users how to use this brick.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1270,6 +1270,11 @@
     <string name="brick_web_request">Send web request to</string>
     <string name="brick_web_request_result">and store answer in</string>
     <string name="brick_web_request_default_value">https://official-joke-api.appspot.com/random_joke</string>
+    <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_store">Store column #</string>
+    <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_csv">of CSV</string>
+    <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_into">into list</string>
+    <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_data">CSV data</string>

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_store">Store column #</string>
          
          
            
                <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_store">Store column</string>
          
      
    
    
  

The # sign can be left away without changing the meaning, and the default number 1 makes clear what is meant.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1270,6 +1270,11 @@
     <string name="brick_web_request">Send web request to</string>
     <string name="brick_web_request_result">and store answer in</string>
     <string name="brick_web_request_default_value">https://official-joke-api.appspot.com/random_joke</string>
+    <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_store">Store column #</string>

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_csv">of CSV</string>
          
          
            
                <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_csv">of the\ncomma-separated values</string>
          
      
    
    
  

Let's make it clear. Please somehow add a line break in the layout as indicated, to make the lines more balanced. May need some additional tuning ;)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1270,6 +1270,11 @@
     <string name="brick_web_request">Send web request to</string>
     <string name="brick_web_request_result">and store answer in</string>
     <string name="brick_web_request_default_value">https://official-joke-api.appspot.com/random_joke</string>
+    <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_store">Store column #</string>
+    <string name="brick_store_csv_into_userlist_csv">of CSV</string>
